MESSAGE.MSG: Fields with GENERATED clause

! ! ! A T T E N T I O N ! ! !
The Rapid Fire job contains files, which have fields with the SQL GENERATED clause. If you use Rapid Fire for such files, then the
values of the fields with the SQL GENERATED clause will be regenerated for each record in the files. The current IBM i release
provides a feature to avoid this. This feature is controlled by the global variable REPLICATION_OVERRIDE. You can find a brief
description of this global variable here: https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/6828143 . The usage of this global variable is
protected by the function QIBM_DB_GENCOL_OVERRIDE. Currently you are NOT allowed to use the global variable REPLICATION_OVERRIDE.
To be allowed to use the global variable REPLICATION_OVERRIDE a user with special authority *SECADM has to execute the following
command: CHGFCNUSG FCNID(QIBM_DB_GENCOL_OVERRIDE) USER(<user-profile>) USAGE(*ALLOWED). IF YOU CONTINUE, THEN THE VALUES WILL BE
REGENERATED. We advise you to cancel. You can continue if you really understand what this means and if this causes NO problems
in your application. It is your decision. Be warned. The wrong decision can destroy your entire application.

values of the fields with the SQL GENERATED clause will be regenerated for each record in the files. IF YOU CONTINUE, THEN THE
